intro: Bartsia tachirensis, commonly known as the Tachira bartsia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in cloud forests. Its flowers are small and clustered, usually displaying shades of pink or purple. Bartsia tachirensis is characterized by its slender stems and lance-shaped leaves.
